ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] OT Complete heal (was Numbers on Bards)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... sure, they d be fine, as long as you were a good puller heh.  even if you weren t that great a puller at first, you d be ok, as long as they were good at
ygData.messageBody:
At 11:22 AM 1/23/01 -0600, you wrote:
> No the whole group. The active lineup of my guild near my level is
>Currently Four Druids, Two Paladins, A Ranger and myself. Most of them just
>got to the 49-50 Range (and Hit 51 pretty fast 49 and 50 are pretty easy to
>level through) and want to group together. Many of them didn't even spend
>time in Karnor until recently and are looking to me (52) and the 53 Druid
>(Guild leader) to take them to places like Sebelis and Chardok.
>
> So my concern - can a group of typically Three Druids, 2 Paladins (or
>Paladin/Ranger) and a Bard survive in places like

sure, they'd be fine, as long as you were a good puller heh. even if you weren't
that great a puller at first, you'd be ok, as long as they were good at ghettomezzing
(root parking) if you got too many. during the fight, the druids could each shoot
off one dot, dd as mana permits, the paladins can chain stun (may take some
communication), and you can basically do the pulling, depending on how well
the chain stunning went, i'd twist hymn/nivs/largos, or hymn/nivs/haste, and mez
and/or charm if you got extras. oh, and note that ghettomezzing only works on
melee types, not casters, heh. if you get a caster, either they need to fight it
first or you need to mez it.



> For practice - to be honest - I'm more concerned about the rest of the
>group than myself... I've done crowd control very successfully in Karnor
>and even Chardok zone (albeit with different groups often containing a
>Shaman) and relying on Charm...

so it sounds like you're more worried about them assisting and the like. have them
make a hotkey and tell the primary assist never to switch targets unless you tell
him to, heh.


> On the positive - I'm very close to 53 (slightly more than 3 blue bubs) so
>I've excited by my upcoming improved abilities.
>
>Slyde
